Definition:
n. 字母A；第一流的；学业成绩达最高标准的评价符号
abbr. 安（ampere）
Grammar: a bit of, a couple of, a great deal of, a number of
Example: He has a great deal of experience in teaching. 他在教学方面有丰富的经验。

Definition:
n. 放任；狂热
vt. 遗弃；放弃
Grammar: abandon oneself to, abandon hope, abandon ship, abandon a plan
Example: He abandoned himself to despair after the failure. 失败后，他陷入了绝望。

Definition: n. 能力，能耐；才能
Grammar: have the ability to, ability in, to the best of one's ability, demonstrate ability
Example: She has the ability to solve complex problems quickly. 她有快速解决复杂问题的能力。

Definition: adj. 能； 有能力的；能干的
Grammar: be able to, able-bodied, able and willing, able to do something
Example: He is able to finish the task on time. 他能够按时完成任务。

Definition: adj. 反常的，不规则的；变态的
Grammar: abnormal behavior, abnormal conditions, abnormal psychology, abnormal growth
Example: The abnormal weather caused many flight delays. 反常的天气导致许多航班延误。

Definition:
prep. 在…上
adv. 在飞机上； 在船上；在火车上
Grammar: go aboard, aboard a ship, aboard a plane, all aboard
Example: Please go aboard the train quickly. 请快速登上火车。

Definition:
prep. 关于；大约
n. 大致；粗枝大叶；不拘小节的人
adj. 在附近的；四处走动的；在起作用的
adv. 大约；周围；到处
Grammar: about to, talk about, think about, be about something
Example: She is about to leave for school. 她即将出发去学校。

Definition:
prep. 超过；在……上面；在……之上
n. 上文
adj. 上文的
adv. 在上面；在上文
Grammar: above all, above average, above the law, above one's head
Example: Above all, honesty is the most important quality. 最重要的是，诚实是最重要的品质。

Definition:
n. 海外；异国
adj. 往国外的
adv. 在国外；到海外
Grammar: go abroad, study abroad, live abroad, travel abroad
Example: He plans to study abroad next year. 他计划明年出国留学。

Definition: n. 没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意
Grammar: in the absence of, absence from, leave of absence, absence of mind
Example: In the absence of evidence, the case was dismissed. 由于缺乏证据，案件被驳回。

Definition:
adj. 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的
vt. 使缺席
Grammar: absent from, absent-minded, be absent, absent oneself
Example: She was absent from school due to illness. 她因病缺席了学校。

Definition:
n. 绝对；绝对事物
adj. 绝对的；完全的；专制的
Grammar: absolute power, absolute truth, absolute zero, absolute majority
Example: He has absolute confidence in his team. 他对自己的团队有绝对的信心。

Definition: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注
Grammar: absorb knowledge, absorb water, be absorbed in, absorb the cost
Example: The sponge can absorb a lot of water. 海绵能吸收很多水。

Definition:
n. 摘要；抽象；抽象的概念
adj. 抽象的；深奥的
vt. 摘要；提取；使……抽象化；转移(注意力、兴趣等)；使心不在焉
vi. 做摘要；写梗概
Grammar: abstract concept, abstract art, in the abstract, abstract from
Example: The abstract concept of freedom is hard to define. 自由的抽象概念很难定义。

Definition:
n. 大学生，大学教师；学者
adj. 学术的；理论的；学院的
Grammar: academic achievement, academic year, academic research, academic performance
Example: Her academic performance has improved significantly. 她的学业表现显著提高了。

Definition:
n. 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
vt. 强调；重读；带…口音讲话
Grammar: with an accent, accent mark, put the accent on, foreign accent
Example: He speaks English with a strong Chinese accent. 他说英语带有浓重的中国口音。

Definition:
vi. 承认；同意；承兑
vt. 接受；承认；承担；承兑；容纳
Grammar: accept an invitation, accept responsibility, accept the fact, accept as
Example: She accepted the job offer without hesitation. 她毫不犹豫地接受了这份工作邀请。

Definition: adj. 可接受的；合意的；可忍受的
Grammar: acceptable level, acceptable standard, acceptable risk, acceptable to
Example: The quality of the product is acceptable to most customers. 产品的质量对大多数客户来说是可接受的。

Definition:

vt. 使用；存取；接近
Grammar: have access to, gain access, access to information, easy access
Example: Students have access to the library resources. 学生可以使用图书馆资源。

Definition: n. 事故；意外； 意外事件；机遇
Grammar: by accident, traffic accident, accident insurance, accident prevention
Example: He found the lost key by accident. 他偶然找到了丢失的钥匙。

Definition:
n. 次要方面；非主要的特性；临时记号
adj. 意外的；偶然的；附属的；临时记号的
Grammar: accidental discovery, accidental damage, by accident
Example: The accidental discovery of penicillin changed medicine forever. 青霉素的偶然发现永远改变了医学。

Definition: n. 住处，膳宿；调节；和解；预订铺位
Grammar: book accommodation, student accommodation, accommodation facilities
Example: We need to book accommodation for our trip to Beijing. 我们需要为北京之行预订住宿。

Definition:
vt. 陪伴，伴随；伴奏
vi. 伴奏，伴唱
Grammar: accompany sb. to, be accompanied by, accompany on the piano
Example: She will accompany her friend to the airport tomorrow. 她明天将陪朋友去机场。

Definition: vt. 完成；实现；达到
Grammar: accomplish a task, accomplish one's goal, accomplish nothing
Example: With hard work, he accomplished his dream of becoming a doctor. 通过努力，他实现了成为医生的梦想。

Definition:
adj. 相符的；一致的；相应的；和谐的；调和的
adv. 依照；根据；按照
v. 给予( accord的现在分词 )；使和谐一致；使符合；使适合
Grammar: according to, according as
Example: According to the weather forecast, it will rain tomorrow. 根据天气预报，明天会下雨。

Definition:
n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述
vt. 认为；把…视为
vi. 解释；导致；报账
Grammar: bank account, take into account, on account of
Example: You should take all factors into account before making a decision. 在做决定前，你应该考虑所有因素。

Definition: n. 会计师；会计人员
Grammar: certified accountant, accountant's report, work as an accountant
Example: My uncle works as an accountant in a big company. 我叔叔在一家大公司当会计师。

Definition: n.  精确度，准确性
Grammar: with accuracy, accuracy of information, high accuracy
Example: The accuracy of his report was praised by the teacher. 他报告的准确性受到了老师的表扬。

Definition:
vt. 控告，指控；谴责；归咎于
vi. 指责；控告
Grammar: accuse sb. of, be accused of, falsely accuse
Example: He was accused of stealing the money from the office. 他被指控从办公室偷了钱。

Definition:
v. 使习惯于（accustom的过去分词）
adj. 习惯的；通常的；独有的
Grammar: be accustomed to, get accustomed to, accustomed way
Example: She is accustomed to getting up early every morning. 她习惯每天早上早起。

Definition:
n. 疼痛
vi. 疼痛；渴望
Grammar: stomach ache, ache for, aches and pains
Example: After the long run, he had a terrible ache in his legs. 长跑后，他的腿疼得厉害。

Definition:
vt. 取得；获得；实现；成功
vi. 达到预期的目的，实现预期的结果，如愿以偿
Grammar: achieve success, achieve a goal, achieve high grades
Example: She worked hard to achieve high grades in the exam. 她努力学习以在考试中取得高分。

Definition: n. 成就；完成；达到；成绩
Grammar: great achievement, sense of achievement, academic achievement
Example: Winning the competition was a great achievement for the team. 赢得比赛对团队来说是一个巨大的成就。

Definition:
n. 酸；<俚>迷幻药
adj. 酸的；讽刺的；刻薄的
Grammar: acid rain, acid test, acid comment
Example: Acid rain can damage buildings and harm the environment. 酸雨会损坏建筑物并危害环境。

Definition: vt. 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到
Grammar: acknowledge receipt, acknowledge one's mistake, acknowledge help
Example: He acknowledged his mistake and apologized to his friend. 他承认了自己的错误并向朋友道歉。

Definition: vt. 获得；取得；学到；捕获
Grammar: acquire knowledge, acquire a skill, acquire property
Example: It's important to acquire good study habits in high school. 在高中养成好的学习习惯很重要。

Definition:
prep. 穿过；横穿
adv. 横过；在对面
Grammar: across from, come across, across the country
Example: The library is just across from the school gate. 图书馆就在学校大门对面。

Definition:
n. 行为，行动；法令，法案；（戏剧，歌剧的）一幕，段；装腔作势
vt. 扮演；装作，举动像
vi. 行动；扮演，充当；表现，举止；假装，演戏；起作用，见效
Grammar: act as, act on, act out, act of kindness
Example: In the play, she will act as the main character. 在剧中，她将扮演主角。

Definition: n. 行动；活动；功能；战斗；情节
Grammar: take action, in action, action movie, course of action
Example: We must take immediate action to protect the environment. 我们必须立即采取行动保护环境。

Definition:

Grammar: active participant, active voice, active lifestyle
Example: She is an active participant in class discussions. 她是课堂讨论的积极参与者。

Definition: n. 活动；行动；活跃
Grammar: outdoor activity, social activity, physical activity, extracurricular activity
Example: The school organizes various extracurricular activities to enrich students' lives. 学校组织各种课外活动来丰富学生的生活。

Definition: n. 男演员；行动者；作用物
Grammar: famous actor, lead actor, supporting actor, stage actor
Example: He is a famous actor who has starred in many popular movies. 他是一位著名演员，出演过许多热门电影。

Definition: n. 女演员
Grammar: award-winning actress, lead actress, film actress, talented actress
Example: She won the Best Actress award for her outstanding performance. 她因出色的表演获得了最佳女演员奖。

Definition: adj. 真实的，实际的；现行的，目前的
Grammar: actual situation, actual cost, actual experience, in actual fact
Example: The actual cost of the project was much higher than expected. 项目的实际成本比预期高得多。

Definition:
vi. 适应
vt. 使适应；改编
Grammar: adapt to, adapt oneself to, adapt from, adapt for
Example: It took him some time to adapt to the new environment. 他花了一些时间来适应新环境。

Definition:

Grammar: add to, add up, add in, add on

Definition: adj. 附加的，额外的
Grammar: additional information, additional cost, additional time, additional support
Example: We need additional information to complete the report. 我们需要额外的信息来完成报告。

Definition:

Grammar: home address, email address, address the issue, deliver an address
Example: Please write your home address clearly on the envelope. 请在信封上清楚地写下你的家庭地址。

Example: We need adequate preparation to ensure the success of the event. 我们需要充分的准备来确保活动的成功。

Definition:

Grammar: adjust to, adjust oneself, adjust the settings, make adjustments
Example: You can adjust the chair to make it more comfortable. 你可以调整椅子让它更舒适。

Definition: n. 管理；行政；实施；行政机构
Grammar: public administration, business administration, administration of justice, under the administration of
Example: He is studying business administration at university. 他在大学学习工商管理。

Definition:

Grammar: admire for, admire greatly, deeply admire, admire someone's courage
Example: I admire her for her perseverance in overcoming difficulties. 我钦佩她克服困难的毅力。

Definition: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用
Grammar: admission fee, admission to, gain admission, free admission
Example: The admission fee to the museum is 20 yuan for adults. 博物馆的入场费是成人20元。

Definition:
vi. 承认；容许

Grammar: admit to, admit doing, admit that, admit into
Example: He admitted that he had made a mistake in the calculation. 他承认在计算中犯了一个错误。

Definition:

Grammar: adopt a policy, adopt a child, adopt measures, adopt an approach
Example: The company decided to adopt a new marketing strategy. 公司决定采用新的营销策略。

Definition:

adj. 成年的；成熟的
Grammar: young adult, adult education, adult life, become an adult
Example: Adult education provides opportunities for lifelong learning. 成人教育为终身学习提供了机会。

Definition:

vi. 前进；进展；上涨
Grammar: in advance, advance payment, make advances, technological advance
Example: Please book the tickets in advance to avoid disappointment. 请提前订票以免失望。

Definition:

Grammar: advanced technology, advanced level, advanced age, advanced course
Example: The country is known for its advanced technology in renewable energy. 这个国家以其在可再生能源方面的先进技术而闻名。

Grammar: career advancement, scientific advancement, technological advancement, make advancements
Example: Continuous learning is essential for career advancement. 持续学习对职业发展至关重要。

Definition:

Grammar: take advantage of, have an advantage over, to one's advantage, advantage in
Example: She took advantage of the opportunity to study abroad. 她利用这个机会出国留学。

Definition:

Grammar: go on an adventure, sense of adventure, adventure story, adventure park
Example: They decided to go on an adventure in the mountains. 他们决定去山里冒险。

Definition:

Grammar: advertise for, advertise on TV, advertise a product, advertise widely
Example: The company advertised for new employees online. 这家公司在网上招聘新员工。

Grammar: place an advertisement, advertisement campaign, classified advertisement, TV advertisement
Example: He saw an advertisement for a job in the newspaper. 他在报纸上看到一则招聘广告。

Definition: n. 建议；忠告；劝告；通知
Grammar: give advice, take advice, piece of advice, advice on
Example: My teacher gave me some good advice on how to improve my English. 我的老师给了我一些如何提高英语的好建议。

Definition:
vt. 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告

Grammar: advise sb. to do sth., advise against, advise on, strongly advise
Example: The doctor advised him to get more rest. 医生建议他多休息。

Grammar: by aeroplane, aeroplane ticket, model aeroplane, aeroplane crash
Example: They traveled to Beijing by aeroplane. 他们乘飞机去北京旅行。

Definition: n. 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事
Grammar: private affair, state of affairs, love affair, mind one's own affairs
Example: It's a private affair, so please don't tell others. 这是私事，请不要告诉别人。

Definition:

vi. 倾向；喜欢
Grammar: affect deeply, affect the outcome, negatively affect, affect one's mood
Example: The bad weather affected our travel plans. 恶劣的天气影响了我们的旅行计划。

Definition: n. 喜爱，感情；影响；感染
Grammar: show affection, deep affection, affection for, mutual affection
Example: She has a deep affection for her grandparents. 她对祖父母有深厚的感情。

Definition: vt. 给予，提供；买得起
Grammar: afford to do sth., can't afford, afford the time, afford a car
Example: I can't afford to buy a new phone right now. 我现在买不起新手机。

Grammar: be afraid of, afraid to do, I'm afraid, afraid that
Example: Many children are afraid of the dark. 许多孩子害怕黑暗。

Definition:
conj. 在……之后

adv. 后来，以后
Grammar: after all, look after, day after day, after school
Example: After school, he usually goes to the library to study. 放学后，他通常去图书馆学习。

Definition: n. 午后，下午
Grammar: in the afternoon, afternoon tea, good afternoon, afternoon nap
Example: We have a meeting in the afternoon. 我们下午有个会议。

Definition:

Grammar: again and again, once again, time and again, never again
Example: He failed the test, but he decided to try again. 他考试没及格，但他决定再试一次。

Definition:

Grammar: against the law, fight against, against one's will, against the wall
Example: Smoking in public places is against the law. 在公共场所吸烟是违法的。

Definition:
n. 年龄；时代；寿命，使用年限；阶段

vi. 成熟；变老
Grammar: at the age of, age group, old age, come of age
Example: She started learning piano at the age of five. 她五岁开始学钢琴。

Definition:

Grammar: aged care, the aged, aged wine, aged population
Example: The aged need more care and attention from society. 老年人需要社会更多的关心和关注。

Grammar: travel agency, news agency, government agency, agency fee
Example: She booked her holiday through a travel agency. 她通过旅行社预订了假期。

Definition:
n. 代理人，代理商；药剂；特工
adj. 代理的
vt. 由…作中介；由…代理
Grammar: secret agent, real estate agent, travel agent, cleaning agent
Example: The real estate agent helped them find a new apartment. 房地产经纪人帮助他们找到了新公寓。

Definition: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的
Grammar: aggressive behavior, aggressive marketing, take an aggressive approach, aggressive expansion
Example: His aggressive attitude made it difficult to work with him. (他咄咄逼人的态度让人难以与他共事。)

Definition:
adj. 以前的；过去的
adv. 以前，以往
Grammar: long ago, a while ago, not long ago, years ago
Example: I met him a few days ago at the library. (几天前我在图书馆遇到了他。)

Definition:
vi. vi. 同意，意见一致；约定，商定

Grammar: agree with, agree on, agree to do something, agree that
Example: We all agree that protecting the environment is important. (我们都同意保护环境很重要。)

Definition: adj. 令人愉快的；适合的；和蔼可亲的
Grammar: agreeable weather, agreeable personality, find something agreeable, be agreeable to
Example: She has an agreeable personality and gets along well with everyone. (她性格随和，与大家相处融洽。)

Definition: n. 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
Grammar: modern agriculture, agriculture industry, develop agriculture, sustainable agriculture
Example: Agriculture plays a vital role in the country's economy. (农业在该国经济中起着至关重要的作用。)

Definition:
adj. 向前；在前的；领先
adv. 向前地；领先地；在（某人或某事物的）前面；预先；在将来，为未来
Grammar: go ahead, ahead of time, look ahead, get ahead
Example: We need to plan ahead to ensure the project's success. (我们需要提前计划以确保项目成功。)

Definition:
n. 援助；帮助；助手；帮助者
vt. 援助；帮助；有助于
vi. 帮助
Grammar: first aid, foreign aid, aid in, with the aid of

Definition: abbr. 获得性免疫缺乏综合征；爱滋病（Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome）

Definition:
n. 建筑师
缔造者
Grammar: chief architect, famous architect, architect of something, work as an architect
Example: The architect designed a modern building that won many awards. 这位建筑师设计了一座赢得许多奖项的现代建筑。

Definition: n. 建筑学；建筑风格；建筑式样；架构
Grammar: classical architecture, modern architecture, study architecture, architecture style
Example: She is studying architecture at university to become a designer. 她在大学学习建筑学，想成为一名设计师。

Definition: n. 区域，地区；面积；范围
Grammar: rural area, urban area, area of expertise, total area
Example: This park covers a large area and is popular for picnics. 这个公园面积很大，是野餐的热门地点。

Definition:
vi. 争论，辩论；提出理由
vt. 辩论，争论；证明；说服
Grammar: argue with someone, argue about something, argue for/against, argue that
Example: They often argue about politics during dinner. 他们经常在晚餐时争论政治问题。

Definition: n. 论证；论据；争吵；内容提要
Grammar: strong argument, have an argument, argument against, main argument
Example: His argument was convincing and changed many people's minds. 他的论据很有说服力，改变了许多人的想法。

Definition: vi. 出现；上升；起立
Grammar: arise from, problems arise, opportunity arises, arise naturally
Example: A new problem may arise if we don't plan carefully. 如果我们不仔细计划，可能会出现新问题。

Definition: n. 算术，算法
Grammar: basic arithmetic, mental arithmetic, arithmetic operations, arithmetic skills
Example: Children learn arithmetic in elementary school to solve math problems. 孩子们在小学学习算术来解决数学问题。

Definition:
n. 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
vt. 武装；备战
vi. 武装起来
Grammar: arm in arm, strong arm, arm of the law, arm oneself
Example: She broke her arm while playing basketball. 她在打篮球时摔断了手臂。

Definition: n. 陆军，军队
Grammar: join the army, army officer, army base, army training
Example: He decided to join the army after graduating from high school. 他高中毕业后决定参军。

Definition:
prep. 四处；在…周围
adv. 大约；到处；在附近
Grammar: around the world, around here, turn around, all around
Example: We walked around the park to enjoy the scenery. 我们在公园里四处走走，欣赏风景。

Definition:

Grammar: arouse interest, arouse suspicion, arouse emotions, arouse curiosity
Example: The mysterious story aroused her curiosity to read more. 这个神秘的故事激起了她的好奇心，想读更多。

Definition:

Grammar: arrange a meeting, arrange flowers, arrange for something, arrange in order
Example: She will arrange the books on the shelf by author. 她会按作者把书排列在书架上。

Definition: n. 布置；整理；准备
Grammar: make arrangements, seating arrangement, financial arrangement, arrangement of things
Example: The seating arrangement at the wedding was carefully planned. 婚礼的座位安排经过了精心策划。

Definition:
n. 逮捕；监禁

Grammar: under arrest, arrest someone, arrest the development, arrest attention
Example: The police arrested the suspect for theft. 警察因盗窃逮捕了嫌疑人。

Definition: n. 到来；到达；到达者
Grammar: on arrival, arrival time, new arrival, arrival of something
Example: We waited at the airport for the arrival of our friends. 我们在机场等待朋友们的到来。

Definition: vi. 到达；成功；达成；出生
Grammar: arrive at, arrive in, arrive on time, arrive safely
Example: They will arrive at the station at 3 PM. 他们将在下午3点到达车站。

Definition:

Grammar: shoot an arrow, arrow key, arrow sign, straight as an arrow
Example: He aimed the arrow at the target and hit the center. 他把箭瞄准靶子，击中了中心。

Definition:
n. 艺术；美术；艺术品

Grammar: work of art, art gallery, art form, art history
Example: She enjoys visiting art museums to see famous paintings. 她喜欢参观艺术博物馆看名画。

Definition:

Grammar: read an article, article of clothing, definite article, article about something
Example: I read an interesting article about climate change in the newspaper. 我在报纸上读了一篇关于气候变化的有趣文章。

Definition: adj. 人造的；仿造的；虚伪的；非原产地的；武断的
Grammar: artificial intelligence, artificial flowers, artificial sweetener, artificial light
Example: The artificial grass in the garden looks very real. 花园里的人造草看起来非常逼真。

Definition: n. 艺术家；美术家（尤指画家）；大师
Grammar: a famous artist, a talented artist, a street artist, an artist's studio
Example: The famous artist painted a beautiful landscape that attracted many visitors. 这位著名艺术家画了一幅美丽的风景画，吸引了许多游客。

Definition:
conj. 因为；随着；虽然；依照；当…时
prep. 如同；当作；以…的身份
adv. 同样地；和…一样的
Grammar: as...as, as if, as well as, as a result
Example: As it was raining heavily, we decided to stay indoors. 因为雨下得很大，我们决定待在室内。

Definition: n. 灰；灰烬
Grammar: turn to ash, ash from a fire, volcanic ash, ash tray
Example: After the fire, only ash remained of the old house. 火灾过后，老房子只剩下灰烬。

Definition: adj. 惭愧的，感到难为情的；耻于……的
Grammar: be ashamed of, feel ashamed, ashamed to do something, deeply ashamed
Example: He felt ashamed of his rude behavior at the party. 他对自己在聚会上的粗鲁行为感到惭愧。

Definition:
prep. 在…旁边

adv. 离开，撇开；在旁边
Grammar: set aside, aside from, step aside, put aside
Example: She set aside some money every month for her future studies. 她每月存一些钱以备将来学习之用。

Definition:

vi. 问，询问；要求
Grammar: ask for, ask about, ask someone to do something, ask a question
Example: The teacher asked the students to finish their homework by Friday. 老师要求学生们在周五前完成作业。

Definition:

Grammar: fall asleep, fast asleep, sound asleep, half asleep
Example: The baby fell asleep quickly after drinking milk. 婴儿喝完奶后很快就睡着了。

Definition: n. 方面；方向；形势；外貌
Grammar: in every aspect, an important aspect, different aspects, aspect of life
Example: We need to consider all aspects of the problem before making a decision. 在做出决定之前，我们需要考虑问题的所有方面。

Definition: n. 阿司匹林（解热镇痛药）
Grammar: take aspirin, aspirin tablet, a dose of aspirin, aspirin for headache
Example: She took an aspirin to relieve her headache. 她吃了一片阿司匹林来缓解头痛。

Definition:

Grammar: assemble a team, assemble quickly, assemble parts, assemble for a meeting
Example: The students were asked to assemble in the school hall at 9 a.m. 学生们被要求上午9点在学校礼堂集合。

Grammar: assess the situation, assess damage, assess performance, assess value

Definition:

Grammar: assign homework, assign a task, assign roles, assign to someone
Example: The manager assigned the new project to the most experienced team. 经理将新项目分配给了最有经验的团队。

Definition:

Grammar: assist with, assist in doing something, assist someone, provide assistance
Example: The volunteer offered to assist the elderly lady with her groceries. 志愿者主动帮助那位老妇人拿杂货。

Grammar: personal assistant, teaching assistant, assistant manager, assistant to someone
Example: She works as an assistant to the director in a large company. 她在一家大公司担任董事的助理。

Definition:

Grammar: associate with, associate degree, associate professor, business associate

Grammar: in association with, trade association, student association, free association

Definition:

Grammar: assume responsibility, assume that, assume a role, assume control

Example: The magician's performance astonished the entire audience. 魔术师的表演让全场观众都感到惊讶。

Grammar: become an astronaut, astronaut training, space astronaut, famous astronaut
Example: The astronaut conducted experiments in space for six months. 这位宇航员在太空中进行了六个月的实验。

Definition:
prep. 在（表示存在或出现的地点、场所、位置、空间）；以（某种价格、速度等）；向；达；因为；朝；忙于
n. 阿特（老挝货币基本单位att）；砹（极不稳定放射性元素）
abbr. 密封的（airtight）；气温（air temperature）
Grammar: at home, at school, at the moment, at first
Example: He is waiting for you at the school gate. 他在学校门口等你。

Definition: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人
Grammar: professional athlete, Olympic athlete, track and field athlete, athlete's foot
Example: The young athlete won a gold medal in the competition. 这位年轻运动员在比赛中赢得了一枚金牌。

Definition: n. 原子
Grammar: atom bomb, split the atom, atomic structure, carbon atom

Definition: adj. 原子的，原子能的；微粒子的

Definition:

Grammar: attach importance to, attach a file, attach to, become attached to

Definition:

Grammar: under attack, launch an attack, heart attack, attack on

Definition:

Definition:

Definition:

Grammar: attract attention, attract customers, attract investment, attract tourists
Example: The beautiful scenery attracts many tourists every year. 美丽的风景每年吸引许多游客。

Grammar: target audience, live audience, audience participation, audience reaction

Example: The teacher used audio-visual aids to make the lesson more interesting. 老师使用视听教具使课程更有趣。

Grammar: aunt and uncle, visit one's aunt, maternal aunt, paternal aunt

Definition:

Grammar: author of the book, famous author, co-author, author's note

Grammar: auto industry, auto repair, auto show, auto parts

Definition:

Grammar: in autumn, autumn leaves, autumn harvest, autumn festival

Definition:

Grammar: on average, average temperature, above average, average out

Grammar: awake to, stay awake, wide awake, awake from sleep
Example: She was awake all night thinking about the exam. 她整晚醒着思考考试的事情。

Grammar: awaken interest, awaken memories, awaken to reality, awaken early

Grammar: award ceremony, award prize, award scholarship, award medal
Example: She received an award for her excellent performance. 她因出色的表现获得了一个奖项。

Grammar: awful weather, awful mistake, awful smell, feel awful
Example: The weather was awful yesterday, so we stayed indoors. 昨天天气很糟糕，所以我们待在室内。

Grammar: awkward situation, awkward silence, awkward movement, feel awkward
Example: He felt awkward when he forgot his friend's name. 当他忘记朋友的名字时，他感到尴尬。

Grammar: back up, back down, back home, back and forth

Grammar: background information, background music, cultural background, in the background

Definition:

Grammar: bad at, bad for, go bad, feel bad about

Grammar: bake a cake, bake bread, bake in the oven, bake off

Definition: n. 餐后甜点；甜点心

Definition: n. 目的地，终点

Definition: vt. 破坏；消灭；毁坏

Example: The earthquake destroyed many buildings in the city. (地震摧毁了城市里的许多建筑。)

Definition: n. 破坏，毁灭；摧毁

Example: Please explain the plan in detail so everyone understands. (请详细解释这个计划，以便每个人都理解。)

Example: He enjoys reading detective stories in his spare time. 他喜欢在业余时间读侦探故事。

Grammar: determine to do sth, determine on sth, determine by, determine that

Grammar: develop into, develop from, develop a habit, develop skills
Example: The small town has developed into a modern city over the years. 多年来，这个小镇已经发展成为一个现代化城市。

Definition: n. 发展；开发；发育；住宅小区（专指由同一开发商开发的）； 显影

Example: It's important to keep a safe distance when driving. 驾驶时保持安全距离很重要。

Definition: n. 收入

Definition:

Definition:

Grammar: read an E-book, download E-books, E-book reader, E-book format

版次

 举例；比如；比如说

Grammar: send an e-mail, e-mail address, e-mail system, check e-mail

Grammar: E-mail address, send E-mail, E-mail communication, E-mail attachment

Definition:
n. 很多；充足
adj. 充足的
adv. 足够地，充足地
int. 够了！
Grammar: enough to do, more than enough, have enough of, old enough
Example: He is old enough to make his own decisions. 他已经足够大，可以自己做决定了。

Definition:
vi. 注册；参军
vt. 登记；卷起；入学；使入会
Grammar: enrol in, enrol for a course, enrol as a member, enrol at university
Example: She decided to enrol in a Spanish language course. 她决定报名参加西班牙语课程。

Definition:
vi. 参加；登记；注册；记入名册
vt. 登记；使加入；把...记入名册；使入伍
Grammar: enroll in, enroll for, enroll at school, enroll new students
Example: Many students enroll in online courses to improve their skills. 许多学生报名在线课程以提高技能。

Definition: vt. 保证，确保；使安全
Grammar: ensure that, ensure safety, ensure success, ensure quality
Example: Please ensure that all windows are closed before leaving. 离开前请确保所有窗户都已关闭。

Definition:
n.  输入；回车
vt. 进入；开始；参加
vi. 参加，登场；进去
Grammar: enter into, enter for, enter a competition, enter the room
Example: He entered the room quietly so as not to wake the baby. 他悄悄进入房间，以免吵醒婴儿。

Definition: n. 企业；事业；进取心；事业心
Grammar: private enterprise, business enterprise, spirit of enterprise, enterprise zone
Example: His entrepreneurial spirit led him to start a new enterprise. 他的创业精神促使他创办了新企业。

Definition:
vt. 娱乐；招待；怀抱；容纳
vi. 款待
Grammar: entertain guests, entertain an idea, entertain doubts, entertain hopes
Example: They often entertain friends at their home on weekends. 他们经常在周末在家里招待朋友。

Definition: n. 演艺人员，表演者
Grammar: professional entertainer, street entertainer, talented entertainer, popular entertainer
Example: The circus features many skilled entertainers. 马戏团有许多技艺高超的表演者。

Definition:
v. 款待（entertain的ing形式）
adj. 令人愉快的
Grammar: highly entertaining, entertaining story, entertaining show, find something entertaining
Example: The movie was both educational and entertaining. 这部电影既有教育意义又令人愉快。

Definition: n. 娱乐；消遣；款待
Grammar: entertainment industry, source of entertainment, home entertainment, live entertainment
Example: Reading is her favorite form of entertainment. 阅读是她最喜欢的娱乐方式。

Definition: n. 热心，热忱，热情
Grammar: with enthusiasm, show enthusiasm, lack of enthusiasm, full of enthusiasm
Example: The team showed great enthusiasm for the new project. 团队对新项目表现出极大的热情。

Definition: adj. 热情的；热心的；狂热的
Grammar: enthusiastic about, enthusiastic response, enthusiastic supporter, less than enthusiastic
Example: She is enthusiastic about learning new languages. 她对学习新语言充满热情。

Definition: adj. 全部的，整个的；全体的
Grammar: entire life, entire process, entire family, entire world
Example: He spent his entire childhood in the countryside. 他的整个童年都在乡村度过。

Definition: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利
Grammar: entitle to, be entitled to do, entitle someone to something, feel entitled
Example: This ticket entitles you to a free drink. 这张票使你有权获得一杯免费饮料。

Definition:
n. 入口；进入
vt. 使出神，使入迷
Grammar: entrance exam, main entrance, entrance fee, make an entrance
Example: The entrance to the museum is on the left side. 博物馆的入口在左侧。

Definition: n. 信封，封皮；包膜； 包层；包迹
Grammar: sealed envelope, envelope address, push the envelope, envelope of sound
Example: She put the letter in an envelope and mailed it. 她把信放进信封并寄了出去。

Definition: n. 环境，外界
Grammar: natural environment, protect the environment, environmental protection, living environment
Example: We should take actions to protect the environment for future generations. 我们应该采取行动为子孙后代保护环境。

Definition:
n. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕
vt. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕
vi. 感到妒忌；显示出妒忌
Grammar: envy sb., green with envy, feel envy, out of envy
Example: She couldn't help but envy her friend's success. 她忍不住嫉妒她朋友的成功。

Definition:
n. 对手；匹敌；同辈；相等的事物
adj. 平等的；相等的；胜任的
vt. 等于；比得上
Grammar: equal to, be equal in, equal rights, on equal terms
Example: All students should have equal opportunities in education. 所有学生在教育中都应该有平等的机会。

Definition: vt. 装备，配备
Grammar: equip with, equip for, be equipped to do, well-equipped
Example: The school is equipped with modern computers for students. 学校为学生配备了现代化的电脑。

Definition: n. 设备，装备；器材
Grammar: sports equipment, medical equipment, equipment failure, safety equipment
Example: The factory invested in new equipment to improve efficiency. 工厂投资了新设备以提高效率。

Definition:
n. 等价物，相等物
adj. 等价的，相等的；同意义的
Grammar: equivalent to, be equivalent in, equivalent value, chemical equivalent
Example: This certificate is equivalent to a high school diploma. 这个证书相当于高中文凭。

Grammar: er (as a filler word), er sound, hesitation marker
Example: He paused and said, "Er, I'm not sure about that." 他停顿了一下说：“呃，我不太确定那个。”

Definition: n. 橡皮；擦除器； 清除器
Grammar: pencil eraser, rubber eraser, use an eraser, eraser head
Example: Can I borrow your eraser to correct this mistake? 我可以借你的橡皮来改正这个错误吗？

Definition:
vt. 使竖立；建造；安装
adj. 竖立的；笔直的；因性刺激而勃起的
vi. 直立；勃起
Grammar: erect a building, stand erect, erect posture, erect a monument
Example: They plan to erect a new library in the city center. 他们计划在市中心建造一座新图书馆。

Definition: n. 误差；错误；过失
Grammar: make an error, error in judgment, correct errors, human error
Example: There was a spelling error in his essay. 他的文章里有一个拼写错误。

Definition: n. （美）自动扶梯；电动扶梯
Grammar: take the escalator, escalator safety, up escalator, down escalator
Example: Please hold the handrail when using the escalator. 使用自动扶梯时请握住扶手。

Definition:
n. 逃跑；逃亡；逃走；逃跑工具或方法；野生种；泄漏
vi. 逃脱；避开；溜走；（气体，液体等）漏出；（未受伤或只受了一点伤害而）逃脱；声音（不自觉地）由…发出
vt. 逃避，避开，避免；被忘掉；被忽视
Grammar: escape from, narrow escape, escape route, fire escape
Example: The prisoner managed to escape from the jail last night. 囚犯昨晚设法从监狱逃跑了。

Definition: adv. 特别；尤其；格外
Grammar: especially important, especially for, especially when, especially in
Example: I love all fruits, especially apples and bananas. 我喜欢所有水果，尤其是苹果和香蕉。

Definition:
n. 散文；试图；随笔
vt. 尝试；对…做试验
Grammar: write an essay, essay contest, essay structure, argumentative essay
Example: She wrote an excellent essay on environmental protection. 她写了一篇关于环境保护的优秀文章。

Definition:
n. 本质；要素；要点；必需品
adj. 基本的；必要的；本质的；精华的
Grammar: essential for, essential to, essential element, essential oil
Example: Water is essential for all living things. 水对所有生物都是必不可少的。

Definition:
vi. 植物定植
vt. 建立；创办；安置
Grammar: establish a company, establish relations, establish oneself, well-established
Example: They established a new school in the rural area. 他们在农村地区建立了一所新学校。

Definition:
n. 估计，估价；判断，看法
vt. 估计，估量；判断，评价
vi. 估计，估价
Grammar: estimate the cost, rough estimate, estimate at, time estimate
Example: Can you estimate how long it will take to finish the project? 你能估计完成这个项目需要多长时间吗？

Definition: abbr. 等等（et cetera，等于and so on）
Grammar: etc. (abbreviation), use etc., list etc., and etc.
Example: We need to buy fruits like apples, oranges, bananas, etc. 我们需要买水果，比如苹果、橙子、香蕉等等。

Definition:
na. 以及其他
 等等；等等等等；诸如此类
Grammar: et cetera (full form), and et cetera, use et cetera, list et cetera
Example: The store sells clothes, shoes, accessories, et cetera. 这家商店卖衣服、鞋子、配饰等等。

Definition: n. 前夕；傍晚；重大事件关头
Grammar: on the eve of, Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, eve of battle
Example: On the eve of the exam, she reviewed all her notes carefully. 在考试前夕，她仔细复习了所有笔记。

Definition:
adj.  偶数的；平坦的；相等的
adv. 甚至；即使；还；实际上
vt. 使平坦；使相等
vi. 变平；变得可比较；成为相等
Grammar: even if/though, even so, even now, even as
Example: Even if it rains tomorrow, we will still go hiking. 即使明天下雨，我们仍然会去远足。

Definition:
n. 晚上；傍晚；（联欢性的）晚会；后期
adj. 在晚上的；为晚上的；晚上用的
int. 晚上好（等于good evening）
Grammar: in the evening, evening dress, evening news, evening party
Example: We usually watch TV in the evening after dinner. 我们通常在晚饭后看电视。

Definition: n. 事件，大事；项目；结果
Grammar: sports event, major event, in the event of, at all events
Example: The Olympic Games is a major international sports event. 奥运会是一项重大的国际体育赛事。

Definition: adj. 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的
Grammar: eventual success, eventual outcome, eventual goal, eventual result
Example: With hard work, his eventual success is certain. 通过努力工作，他最终的成功是肯定的。

Definition: adv. 永远；曾经；究竟
Grammar: ever since, for ever, hardly ever, ever so
Example: Have you ever been to Beijing? 你曾经去过北京吗？

Definition: adj. 永恒的；接连不断的
Grammar: everlasting love, everlasting memory, everlasting peace, everlasting fame
Example: Their friendship is described as everlasting. 他们的友谊被描述为永恒的。

Definition: adj. 每一的，每个的；每隔…的
Grammar: every day, every other, every now and then, every time
Example: She goes jogging every morning to stay healthy. 她每天早上慢跑以保持健康。

Definition: pron. 每个人；人人
Grammar: everybody knows, everybody else, for everybody, everybody's business
Example: Everybody should do their part to protect the environment. 每个人都应该尽自己的一份力来保护环境。

Definition:
n. 平时；寻常日子
adj. 每天的，日常的
Grammar: everyday life, everyday use, everyday English, everyday routine
Example: Cooking is part of her everyday routine. 烹饪是她日常例行公事的一部分。

Definition:
n. 每个人
pron. 每个人；人人
Grammar: everyone else, everyone knows, for everyone, everyone's favorite
Example: Everyone in the class passed the exam. 班上的每个人都通过了考试。

Definition: pron. 每件事物；最重要的东西；（有关的）一切；万事
Grammar: everything else, everything possible, have everything, mean everything
Example: Family means everything to him. 家庭对他来说意味着一切。

Definition:
n. 每个地方
adv. 到处
Grammar: everywhere else, go everywhere, from everywhere, everywhere you look
Example: You can find fast food restaurants everywhere in the city. 在这个城市到处都能找到快餐店。

Definition:
n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显
vt. 证明
Grammar: strong evidence, evidence shows, in evidence, give evidence
Example: The police found evidence linking him to the crime. 警方找到了将他与犯罪联系起来的证据。

Definition: adj. 明显的；明白的
Grammar: evident that, become evident, make evident, self-evident
Example: It is evident that she has worked very hard. 很明显她工作非常努力。

Definition:
n. 罪恶，邪恶；不幸
adj. 邪恶的；不幸的；有害的；讨厌的
Grammar: evil deeds, fight evil, the root of all evil, evil spirit
Example: In the story, the hero fights against evil forces. 在故事中，英雄与邪恶势力作斗争。

Definition: n. 演变；进化论；进展
Grammar: theory of evolution, human evolution, evolution of, gradual evolution
Example: Darwin's theory of evolution changed our understanding of life. 达尔文的进化论改变了我们对生命的理解。

Definition:
vi. 发展，进展；进化；逐步形成
vt. 发展，进化；进化；使逐步形成；推断出
Grammar: evolve into, evolve from, evolve over time, evolve gradually
Example: The small town has evolved into a bustling city. 这个小镇已经发展成为一个繁华的城市。

Definition:
adj. 准确的，精密的；精确的
vt. 要求；强求；急需
vi. 勒索钱财
Grammar: exact time, exact amount, exact copy, exact opposite
Example: Please give me the exact number of students in the class. 请告诉我班上学生的确切人数。

Definition: adv. 恰好地；正是；精确地；正确地
Grammar: exactly the same, exactly right, exactly how, exactly when
Example: The two paintings look exactly the same. 这两幅画看起来一模一样。

Definition: n. 考试；测验
Grammar: take an exam, pass an exam, exam paper, final exam
Example: He studied hard to pass the final exam. 他努力学习以通过期末考试。

Definition: n. 考试；检查；查问
Grammar: take an examination, pass an examination, fail an examination, medical examination
Example: He passed the final examination with flying colors. 他以优异的成绩通过了期末考试。

Definition:
vt. 检查；调查； 检测；考试
vi. 检查；调查
Grammar: examine carefully, examine the evidence, examine a patient, examine oneself
Example: The doctor will examine the patient thoroughly. 医生将彻底检查病人。

Definition:
n. 例子；榜样
vt. 作为…的例子；为…做出榜样
vi. 举例
Grammar: for example, set an example, follow the example, give an example
Example: For example, you can use this method to solve the problem. 例如，你可以用这个方法解决问题。

Definition: adj. 卓越的；极好的；杰出的
Grammar: excellent performance, excellent quality, excellent opportunity, excellent student
Example: She gave an excellent performance in the play. 她在剧中表现非常出色。

Definition:
conj. 除了；要不是
prep. 除…之外
vt. 不计；把…除外
vi. 反对
Grammar: except for, except that, except when, except as
Example: Everyone attended the meeting except Tom. 除了汤姆，所有人都参加了会议。

Definition:
n. 交换；交流；交易所；兑换
vt. 交换；交易；兑换
vi. 交换；交易；兑换
Grammar: exchange ideas, exchange gifts, in exchange for, exchange rate
Example: They often exchange ideas about their studies. 他们经常交流学习心得。

Definition:
vt. 激起；刺激…，使…兴奋
vi. 激动
Grammar: excite interest, excite curiosity, excite attention, excite enthusiasm
Example: The news excited everyone in the room. 这个消息让房间里的每个人都兴奋起来。

Definition:
v. 激动；唤起（excite的过去分词）
adj. 兴奋的；激动的；活跃的
Grammar: get excited, feel excited, excited about, excited to do
Example: The children were excited about the upcoming trip. 孩子们对即将到来的旅行感到兴奋。

Definition: n. 兴奋；刺激；令人兴奋的事物
Grammar: with excitement, full of excitement, cause excitement, sense of excitement
Example: The announcement caused great excitement among the students. 这个公告在学生中引起了极大的兴奋。

Definition:
vt. 大声说出
vi. 呼喊，惊叫；大声叫嚷
Grammar: exclaim in surprise, exclaim with joy, exclaim loudly, exclaim against
Example: She exclaimed in surprise when she saw the gift. 她看到礼物时惊讶地叫了起来。

Definition: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出
Grammar: exclude from, exclude the possibility, exclude others, exclude doubt
Example: The rule excludes children under 12 from participating. 这条规则排除了12岁以下儿童参加。

Definition: n. 偏移；远足；短程旅行；离题；游览，游览团
Grammar: go on an excursion, school excursion, one-day excursion, excursion ticket
Example: We went on a one-day excursion to the mountains. 我们进行了一天的山地远足。

Definition:
n. 借口；理由
vt. 原谅；为…申辩；给…免去
vi. 作为借口；请求宽恕；表示宽恕
Grammar: make an excuse, excuse me, excuse for, without excuse
Example: He made an excuse for being late. 他为迟到找了个借口。

Definition:
n. 总经理；执行委员会；执行者；经理主管人员
adj. 行政的；经营的；执行的，经营管理的
Grammar: chief executive, executive committee, executive director, executive power
Example: The executive director made an important decision. 执行董事做出了一个重要决定。

Definition:
n. 运动；练习；运用；操练；礼拜；典礼
vt. 锻炼；练习；使用；使忙碌；使惊恐
vi. 运动；练习
Grammar: do exercise, physical exercise, exercise caution, exercise influence
Example: It's important to do regular exercise to stay healthy. 定期锻炼以保持健康很重要。

Definition:
n. 排气；废气；排气装置
vt. 排出；耗尽；使精疲力尽；彻底探讨
vi. 排气
Grammar: exhaust pipe, exhaust fumes, exhaust oneself, exhaust resources
Example: The long journey exhausted all the travelers. 长途旅行使所有旅行者都精疲力尽。

Definition:
n. 展览品；证据；展示会
vt. 展览；显示；提出（证据等）
vi. 展出；开展览会
Grammar: exhibit signs, exhibit behavior, on exhibit, exhibit hall
Example: The museum will exhibit ancient artifacts next month. 博物馆下个月将展出古代文物。

Definition: n. 展览，显示；展览会；展览品
Grammar: art exhibition, hold an exhibition, exhibition center, on exhibition
Example: The art exhibition attracted many visitors. 这次艺术展览吸引了许多参观者。

Definition: vi. 存在；生存；生活；继续存在
Grammar: exist in, exist on, exist as, exist between
Example: Many species exist only in tropical rainforests. 许多物种只存在于热带雨林中。

Definition: n. 存在，实在；生存，生活；存在物，实在物
Grammar: come into existence, in existence, existence of, struggle for existence
Example: The existence of life on other planets is still a mystery. 其他行星上是否存在生命仍然是个谜。

Definition:
n. 出口，通道；退场
vi. 退出；离去
Grammar: emergency exit, exit from, make an exit, exit strategy
Example: Please use the emergency exit in case of fire. 发生火灾时请使用紧急出口。

Definition:
vt. 扩张；使膨胀；详述
vi. 发展；张开，展开
Grammar: expand into, expand on, expand one's horizons, expand rapidly
Example: The company plans to expand into the Asian market next year. 该公司计划明年扩展到亚洲市场。

Definition:
vi. 期待；预期
vt. 期望；指望；认为；预料
Grammar: expect to do, expect sb. to do, as expected, beyond expectation
Example: I expect to finish my homework by 8 p.m. 我预计在晚上8点前完成作业。

Definition:
n. 损失，代价；消费；开支
vt. 向…收取费用
vi. 被花掉
Grammar: at the expense of, living expenses, cut expenses, expense account
Example: He achieved success at the expense of his health. 他以健康为代价取得了成功。

Definition: adj. 昂贵的；花钱的
Grammar: too expensive, expensive taste, expensive hobby, expensive gift
Example: This watch is too expensive for me to afford. 这块手表太贵了，我买不起。

Definition:
n. 经验；经历；体验
vt. 经验；经历；体验
Grammar: work experience, learning experience, gain experience, personal experience
Example: She has rich experience in teaching English. 她在英语教学方面有丰富的经验。

Definition:
n. 实验，试验；尝试
vi. 尝试；进行实验
Grammar: conduct an experiment, scientific experiment, experiment with, experiment on
Example: The students conducted a chemistry experiment in the lab. 学生们在实验室进行了一次化学实验。

Definition:
n. 专家；行家；能手
adj. 熟练的；内行的；老练的
vt. 当专家；在…中当行家
Grammar: expert in, expert advice, expert opinion, become an expert
Example: He is an expert in computer programming. 他是计算机编程方面的专家。

Definition: v. 说明；解释
Grammar: explain to sb., explain why, explain clearly, explain away
Example: Can you explain this grammar rule to me? 你能给我解释一下这个语法规则吗？

Definition: n. 说明，解释；辩解
Grammar: give an explanation, detailed explanation, reasonable explanation, explanation for
Example: She gave a detailed explanation of the project. 她对项目做了详细的解释。

Definition:
vi. 爆炸，爆发；激增
vt. 使爆炸；爆炸；推翻
Grammar: explode with anger, explode into laughter, population explode, explode a bomb
Example: The bomb exploded in the distance. 炸弹在远处爆炸了。

Definition:
n. 勋绩；功绩
vt. 开发，开拓；剥削；开采
Grammar: exploit resources, exploit opportunities, exploit workers, exploit a situation
Example: We should exploit natural resources wisely. 我们应该明智地开发自然资源。

Definition:
vi. 探索；探测；探险
vt. 探索；探测；探险
Grammar: explore the world, explore possibilities, explore space, explore a topic

Grammar: improve on, improve oneself, improve the situation

Definition:

Definition: adv. 很；相当；完全

Definition:

Definition:

Definition:

aux. 将；愿意；必须
Grammar: will power, against one's will, at will, with a will
Example: She succeeded through strong will power and determination. 她凭借坚强的意志力和决心取得了成功。

Definition:
adj. 乐意的；自愿的；心甘情愿的

Grammar: be willing to do, willing helper, willing participant, willing cooperation
Example: He is always willing to help others in need. 他总是乐意帮助有需要的人。

Definition:

Grammar: win a prize, win over, win the game, win through
Example: Our team worked hard to win the championship. 我们队努力赢得了冠军。

Definition:
vi. 缠绕；上发条；吹响号角

Grammar: wind up, wind down, wind through, wind energy

Definition: n. 窗；窗口；窗户
Grammar: window shopping, window of opportunity, window seat, window display
Example: She enjoys window shopping on weekends without buying anything. 她喜欢周末逛街只看不买。

Definition:

Grammar: wine and dine, red wine, white wine, wine tasting
Example: They went to a restaurant to wine and dine their guests. 他们去餐厅款待客人。

Definition:

Grammar: on the wing, take wing, wing it, left wing

Definition: n. 胜利者
Grammar: prize winner, clear winner, winner takes all, born winner

Definition:

Grammar: in winter, winter sports, winter vacation, winter coat

Definition:

Grammar: wipe out, wipe away, wipe off, wipe clean

Grammar: wire transfer, live wire, barbed wire, wire fence
Example: He sent money to his family via wire transfer. 他通过电汇把钱寄给了家人。

Definition: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言
Grammar: words of wisdom, wisdom tooth, conventional wisdom, pearl of wisdom
Example: His grandfather often shares words of wisdom with him. 他的祖父经常与他分享智慧之言。

Definition:

Grammar: wise decision, wise up, wise man, wise choice
Example: It was a wise decision to save money for the future. 为未来存钱是个明智的决定。

Definition:

Grammar: wish for, best wishes, make a wish, wish list
Example: I wish you all the best in your new job. 我祝你在新工作中一切顺利。

Definition:

Grammar: at one's wits' end, quick wit, battle of wits, wit and wisdom
Example: She was at her wits' end trying to solve the problem. 她绞尽脑汁试图解决这个问题。

Definition: prep. 用；随着；支持；和…在一起

Definition:

Definition:

Grammar: do without, without doubt, without fail, without delay

Definition:

Grammar: witness to, bear witness to, witness for, witness against

Definition:

Grammar: cry wolf, wolf down, a wolf in sheep's clothing
Example: The boy wolfed down his dinner because he was very hungry. (男孩狼吞虎咽地吃完了晚餐，因为他非常饿。)

Definition: n. 妇女；女性；成年女子
Grammar: woman of the year, career woman, woman's rights
Example: She is a successful businesswoman who runs her own company. (她是一位成功的女商人，经营着自己的公司。)

Definition:

Grammar: no wonder, wonder about, wonder at, wonder if

Definition: adj. 极好的，精彩的，绝妙的；奇妙的；美妙；胜；神妙

Definition:

Grammar: out of the woods, knock on wood, wood carving
Example: The table is made of solid wood, which makes it very durable. (这张桌子由实木制成，非常耐用。)

Example: He gave a wooden performance in the play, lacking emotion. (他在剧中的表演很呆板，缺乏情感。)

Example: She bought a warm wool sweater for the winter. (她为冬天买了一件温暖的羊毛衫。)

Definition:
n.  单词；话语；消息；诺言；命令

Grammar: in other words, word for word, keep one's word, have a word with
Example: Please keep your word and finish the project on time. (请遵守诺言，按时完成项目。)

Definition:

Grammar: work out, work on, work hard, work together

Definition: n. 世界；领域；世俗；全人类；物质生活

Definition:

Definition:

Grammar: worn out, worn down, well-worn
Example: His shoes were worn out after years of use. (他的鞋子穿了多年后已经磨损了。)

Definition:

Grammar: worry about, don't worry, worry too much, cause worry

Grammar: get worse, worse than, worse off, for better or worse

Grammar: at worst, worst-case scenario, do one's worst

Grammar: worth it, worth doing, worth the effort, net worth

Grammar: feel worthless, worthless advice, a worthless object, prove worthless

Example: Volunteering at the hospital is a worthwhile experience for students. 在医院做志愿者对学生来说是一次值得的经历。

Definition:

Grammar: worthy of, worthy cause, worthy opponent, worthy candidate

Grammar: wound healing, deep wound, wound someone, fatal wound

Definition:

Grammar: car wreck, ship wreck, wreck havoc, emotional wreck

Grammar: write down, write about, write to, write a letter

Definition:

Grammar: do wrong, wrong answer, go wrong, in the wrong

Grammar: X-ray machine, take an X-ray, X-ray examination, X-ray vision
Example: The doctor used an X-ray to check for broken bones. 医生用X光检查是否有骨折。

Definition:

Grammar: back yard, school yard, yard sale, cubic yard
Example: The children played football in the school yard. 孩子们在学校操场上踢足球。

Grammar: last year, new year, year after year, all year round
Example: We plan to travel abroad next year. 我们计划明年出国旅行。

Definition:

Grammar: yearly report, yearly income, yearly meeting, yearly subscription
Example: The company holds a yearly meeting to discuss future plans. 公司每年召开会议讨论未来计划。

Definition:

vi. 变黄或发黄
Grammar: yellow light, yellow fever, turn yellow, bright yellow
Example: The leaves turn yellow in autumn. 树叶在秋天变黄。

Definition:

Grammar: say yes, yes or no, yes man, answer yes
Example: When asked if he would help, he said yes immediately. 当被问及是否愿意帮忙时，他立即答应了。

Definition:
n. 昨天；往昔

Grammar: the day before yesterday, yesterday morning, since yesterday, yesterday's news
Example: I met an old friend yesterday at the park. 我昨天在公园遇到了一位老朋友。

Definition:
conj. 但是；然而
adv. 还；但是；已经
Grammar: not yet, as yet, yet to come, and yet
Example: He hasn't finished his homework yet. 他还没有完成作业。

Definition: n. 酸奶；酵母乳；酸奶酪
Grammar: a cup of yoghourt, low-fat yoghourt, fruit yoghourt, plain yoghourt
Example: She enjoys having a cup of yoghourt for breakfast every morning. 她喜欢每天早上喝一杯酸奶当早餐。

Grammar: Greek yoghurt, frozen yoghurt, yoghurt drink, probiotic yoghurt
Example: Greek yoghurt is rich in protein and calcium. 希腊酸奶富含蛋白质和钙。

Definition: n. 酸奶酪， 酸乳（等于yoghurt）
Grammar: yogurt maker, yogurt culture, yogurt parfait, yogurt smoothie
Example: He made a delicious yogurt parfait with fresh berries. 他用新鲜浆果做了一个美味的酸奶冻糕。

Definition: pron. 你；你们
Grammar: you and me, thank you, as you know, you bet
Example: You should always be honest with your friends. 你应该始终对朋友诚实。

Definition:
n. 年轻人；（动物的）崽，仔

Grammar: young people, young at heart, young adult, young and old
Example: Young people today face many challenges in the job market. 今天的年轻人在就业市场面临许多挑战。

Definition: n. 年轻人；少年
Grammar: energetic youngster, youngster's dream, group of youngsters, talented youngster
Example: The energetic youngster won first prize in the competition. 这个精力充沛的年轻人在比赛中赢得了一等奖。

Grammar: your turn, your own, your best, your choice
Example: Is this your book on the table? 桌子上的这本书是你的吗？

Definition:

Grammar: yours truly, yours sincerely, all yours, of yours
Example: The red car is mine, and the blue one is yours. 红色的车是我的，蓝色的是你的。

Definition: pron. 你自己
Grammar: by yourself, help yourself, enjoy yourself, be yourself

Grammar: by yourselves, help yourselves, enjoy yourselves, introduce yourselves

Grammar: youth culture, youth hostel, youth movement, in one's youth
Example: He spent his youth studying hard to become a doctor. 他年轻时努力学习，想成为一名医生。

Definition:
num. 零

Grammar: zero tolerance, zero in on, zero hour, below zero
Example: The temperature dropped to zero degrees Celsius last night. 昨晚气温降到了零摄氏度。

Definition:

vt.& vi. 尖啸而过; （使沿某方向）快速移动
Grammar: zip up, zip code, zip line, zip file
Example: Please remember to zip up your jacket before going outside. 出门前请记得拉上夹克的拉链。

Definition: 地带、地区（德语）
Grammar: time zone, danger zone, comfort zone, no-parking zone
Example: New York is in the Eastern Time Zone. 纽约位于东部时区。

Definition: n. 动物园; <美俚>（铁路货车的最后一节）守车; <美俚>核粒子园
Grammar: go to the zoo, zoo keeper, zoo animal, zoo visit
Example: The children were excited to see the pandas at the zoo. 孩子们在动物园看到熊猫时很兴奋。
